message:
Guys, just a wake up call. I am mainly a lurker here and I do not post that much, but I am turning off the notifications from the group and directing my attention else where.

It is not like Einstein is leaving the group of course, but a humble notification of how the group is turning into a trivial Q/A forum every passing day. It is like 10% geeky stuff and 90% "would you please debug my code for me?"

data.message: i really want to delete some posts but i don't fell like it's right, i know how'd you feel right now, i feel exactly the same, i think i'll have to be kinda strict as one of the admins, you can keep showing up here for the next couple days, report any post that seems not related to our group and i'll inform the user with a message as usual and will delete the post if it violates the rules (as usual also)

I think it is a members-problem mainly. Apparently many people have joined the group to ask about why their code is not working. 

You would find someone posting about a code error and in a few minutes there would be tens of comments on it, with absolutely no regard to the group rules or even the group title.

And buried under this trivia some important posts like the recent freelancer one.

If you think a post shouldn't be here, just report it to admin using the report tool, it helps a lot, we all volunteer time to manage the group and we can't check each and every post, so if you can point out the offending ones it helps.
ok, i reviewed some of the latest posts here deleted some of them and informed all the OPs about the reason of deletion, i hope that helps raising the quality of the posts in here.

Mohamed, this is why I was hesitating to make a big fuss out of it; the admins are not getting paid to do this and we all have stuff to do. 

I do not want this to appear as a customer complaint sort of thing, since this is not a business. I am rather annoyed that the quality of an interesting group is declining.

There is no fuss, this is a valuable feedback, and something we need every now and then to make sure we don't deviate from our track, and I agree with you that we haven't been as proactive as we used to be, and we should educate the users about our guidelines, and let them know what the purpose of the group is and most importantly what it is NOT.

Instead you guys can do something else, a QA 
stackoverflow style" or any other way to guide this people to the right direction. They only ask because they really don't know...SHARE THE KNOWLEDGE :)
There many other places where this is available. Why do we need to reinvent the wheel?
Guide them to this places they probably have no idea where they are, put it through the proper channels, and by the time they will disappear from here and voila !

I think it is just part of the growing pain that we need to deal with, few years back this group had tens of people almost everybody knew everybody else, no need to have written rules, and everything was based on "Common Sense", after a while we had to add some rules, then we needed to enforce them, now I guess we need to deal with this similarly, we just need to find a good way to communicate this without being a**holes deleting posts and blocking users left and right and making everybody angry.

This group was created to answer a question: I've passed the beginner phase, now what? We try to help each other gain more experience. You learnt SQL, so what the the differences between different DBs?

There are many places on the internet for beginners resources. Google knows better than anyone here. Questions like "I just installed a DB. How can I connect to it?" is just lazy. He didn't even tell us what kind of DB he's using! and if he searched for on Google, he will find an answer (either in English or Arabic).

This group is not against beginners. It's against laziness.

question, do admins see how many people reported a post? because that would be very useful for you guys, and will make us feel less hesitant to report stuff (as the burden of being accidentally unfair will be less)
Hassan Aly Selim yes, i always review the reported posts, if it is violating the group rules i send a message to user to notify him and remove the post.
I believe all the admins review reported posts quickly. Sometimes I go to check a report and I find that it is already handled be a fellow

you misunderstood my question, I meant, do you see a number beside every reported post showing how many times it was reported? Kind of like the number of downvotes on reddit.
because sometimes when I'm about to report something, I fear that my judgement isn't good and an admin might take action based on just my and his judgement, but if the count shows up, this will make me more comfortable as it will be a combined judgement of many users :)

Hassan Aly Selim no, there isn't a number next to a report stating how many people have reported it iirc, however you shouldn't worry about whether your judgment was good or not.
If you felt the post was out of context or shouldn't have been posted then report it and we'll take care of it :)

Yes, none of us is getting paid for this but I believe I can safely speak on behalf of a lot of admins here, we've grown quite fond of this small community and are constantly striving to see it successful despite our commitments, I'm serving in the military now and I still keep an eye on the group for at least 6-7 hours a week. I'm pretty sure a lot do the same.

So thanks for the heads up and like most admins have already stated, reports do help us so feel free to carry on.
Ahmed Al-Amir Thansk a lot for the Headsup we will take care of this more and we hope we can count on you on the future when we fix the QA/Forum posts Issues.

I just wanna say that just because we claim to be geeks does not mean we have to belittle the newbies since all of us were new at some phase and are new to many technologies. I agree we shouldn't have the elementary level questions, but that doesn't mean that someone with s serious coding problem shouldn't be able to share it on a group of geeks.
But please remember it is called Egyptian Geeks. NOT Egyptian snobs :)
